adjective.description: Relating to a spiritual or nonphysical realm.
examples: the transcendental importance of each person's soul

adjective.description: (in Kantian philosophy) presupposed in and necessary to experience; a priori.
(of a number, e.g., e or π) real but not a root of an algebraic equation with rational roots.

origin: Early 17th century: from medieval Latin transcendentalis (see transcendent).
